channel.title: Booths on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Booths on My New Hugo Site

item.title: American Charter
item.description: Students using 3D software to design and print blades to test in a windmill challenge. We will do our own video recording and editing.

item.title: CHS CS50AP
item.description: CS50AP is the Harvard curriculum we use for the AP Computer Science Principles course and is the most rigorous, but fun and doable curriculum available. Students learn to code, how computers work “under the hood” and important ethics to understand about our digital world.

item.title: Colony High Digital Media
item.description: Our 4-year digital media program where students learn and practice to tell stories using audio and video through live multicamera events, studio productions, moviemaking, news production, and radio/podcasting.

item.title: Cottonwood Creek Action School
item.description: Video newsletter from students to keep parents better connected during the age of mitigation plans.

item.title: CTHS business
item.description: Pictures or video of our club.

item.title: Iditarod Elementary
item.description: Project on recording and editing using green screen and then students are creating a google form for our reading night which has the teachers reading the stories and attached to a data sheet.

item.title: Palmer - eDynamic
item.description: iTech Program unique opportunities: focus on eDynamic Learning

item.title: Palmer - Gardening
item.description: Hydroponics system, Aquaponics, Composting, Vet Science Tools

item.title: Shaw Elementry School
item.description: Video clips and pictures of the girls' projects.

item.title: Sherod Elemenetry Sphero-bots
item.description: Either Sphero-bots in the classroom, or digital citizenship

item.title: Welcome to the 2021 MSBSD Tech Expo
item.description: On the left, you’ll find the list of booths and sponcers. at the bottom, there’s a button to return to the map of booths. We hope you’ll enjoy your time at the tech Expo!
